safesum.para: Critical warnings used in this manual are repeated here to let you know how important they are. Study these warnings carefully; they can save your life and the lives of others.

item.para: CARBON MONOXIDE POISONING CAN BE DEADLY!

CARBON DIOXIDE GAS (CO). (CO) is a colorless, odorless, poisonous, deadly gas produced by incomplete combustion of any carbon containing material. It occurs in the exhaust fumes of fuel burning heaters and internal combustion engines, and becomes dangerously concentrated under conditions of inadequate ventilation.

SYMPTOMS OF POISONING. Exposure to carbon monoxide (exhaust gas) will result in headaches, dizziness, loss of muscular control, drowsiness or coma. Permanent brain damage or death can result from severe exposure.
PRECAUTIONS TO OBSERVE. To ensure the safety of personnel the following precautions shall be taken whenever the personnel, heater is operated:
Do not operate heater or engine of any vehicle in an enclosed area unless it is adequately ventilated.
Do not operate heater or engine at idle for long periods without maintaining adequate ventilation in personnel compartments.
Do not drive any vehicle with inspection plates or cover plates removed unless necessary for maintenance purposes.
Do not sleep in a vehicle when the heater is operating or the engine is idling.
Be alert at all times during vehicle operation for exhaust odors and exposure symptoms. If either is present, immediately ventilate personnel compartments.
FIRST AID. If symptoms of exhaust gas (CO) poisoning are present, remove affected personnel from vehicle, or confined areas, and treat as follows:
If victim is not breathing, administer artificial respiration. For artificial respiration instructions, refer to FM 21-11.
Administer oxygen, if it is available.
Seek prompt medical attention for possible delayed onset of lung congestion.

caution.para: Crewmen are not authorized to adjust or remove daysight linkages. Improperly installed sight linkages will cause serious damage to the sighting systems.

item.para: Ground guides are required to guide turret so that hydraulic lines, electrical lines, or equipment do not snag while turret is being lifted from stand or lowered onto vehicle.
Turret basket is unable to support weight of turret. To avoid damage to equipment lower turret onto turret stand only.
